content.title: ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY
sections: 1. COMMITMENT: [COMPANY_NAME] is committed to minimizing our environmental impact and operating sustainably. We recognize our responsibility to protect the environment for future generations.
2. SCOPE: All operations, facilities, products, and services.

3. ENVIRONMENTAL PRINCIPLES:

- Comply with all environmental legislation and regulations
- Prevent pollution
- Reduce waste and increase recycling
- Conserve energy and water
- Reduce carbon emissions
- Use resources sustainably
- Protect biodiversity
- Engage with stakeholders on environmental issues
- Continually improve environmental performance

4. LEGAL COMPLIANCE:

We comply with:
- Environmental Protection Act 1990 (waste duty of care)
- Climate Change Act 2008 (net zero by 2050 target)
- Environment Act 2021 (environmental targets, biodiversity net gain)
- Waste (England and Wales) Regulations 2011
- Packaging Waste Regulations
- WEEE Regulations (electrical waste)
- Energy Savings Opportunity Scheme (ESOS) [if large enterprise]
- Streamlined Energy and Carbon Reporting (SECR) [if 250+ employees or turnover >£36m]
- [SECTOR-SPECIFIC REGULATIONS]

5. CARBON REDUCTION:

**Target:** [NET_ZERO_TARGET - e.g., Net zero by 2040, 50% reduction by 2030]

**Actions:**
- Measure and report carbon emissions (Scopes 1, 2, 3)
- Energy efficiency measures (LED lighting, insulation, efficient equipment)
- Renewable energy ([TARGET%] by [YEAR])
- Green energy tariff
- Electric vehicle fleet transition ([TARGET%] by [YEAR])
- Encourage low-carbon commuting (cycle to work, public transport, remote working)
- Carbon offsetting for unavoidable emissions ([OFFSETTING_SCHEME])
- Supplier engagement on carbon reduction

**SECR Reporting:** Annual energy and carbon report published [if applicable].

6. WASTE REDUCTION:

**Waste hierarchy:** Prevent > Reuse > Recycle > Recover > Dispose

**Target:** [WASTE_TARGET - e.g., Zero waste to landfill by 2027, 75% recycling rate]

**Actions:**
- Waste segregation (recycling, food waste, general waste, hazardous waste)
- Reduce single-use plastics
- Reusable alternatives (water bottles, coffee cups, utensils)
- Paperless operations where possible
- Double-sided printing default
- Donate or sell surplus equipment
- Composting [if applicable]
- Licensed waste carriers (duty of care)
- Waste transfer notes retained
- Hazardous waste consignment notes
- WEEE recycling for electrical equipment

7. RESOURCE EFFICIENCY:

**Energy:**
- Smart meters and monitoring
- Auto-off for lights and equipment
- Heating/cooling optimization ([TEMPERATURE_RANGE])
- Energy-efficient equipment (A-rated minimum)
- Renewable energy sources

**Water:**
- Water-efficient fixtures (low-flow taps, dual-flush toilets)
- Fix leaks promptly
- Rainwater harvesting [if applicable]
- Monitor consumption

**Materials:**
- Sustainable sourcing (FSC paper, recycled materials)
- Reduce packaging
- Supplier sustainability criteria

8. SUSTAINABLE PROCUREMENT:

**Procurement criteria:**
- Environmental credentials of suppliers
- Lifecycle environmental impact of products
- Energy efficiency
- Recyclability and recycled content
- Ethical sourcing
- Local suppliers (reduce transport emissions)
- Supplier environmental policies and certifications (ISO 14001)

**Prohibited/Restricted:**
- Single-use plastics (where alternatives available)
- Products containing harmful substances (RoHS compliance)
- Non-sustainably sourced timber or paper

9. TRANSPORT AND TRAVEL:

- Fleet: Transition to electric/hybrid vehicles ([TARGET%] by [YEAR])
- Driver training (eco-driving)
- Vehicle maintenance (fuel efficiency)
- Pool cars (reduce total fleet size)
- Business travel: Prioritize video conferencing over air travel
- Rail over air for domestic travel
- Employee commuting: Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loans, car sharing, remote working
- Delivery optimization (route planning, load efficiency)

10. BIODIVERSITY:

- Biodiversity net gain for development projects (Environment Act 2021: 10% minimum from 2024)
- Protect and enhance green spaces
- Wildlife-friendly landscaping (native plants, pollinator-friendly)
- Avoid harmful pesticides
- Bird/bat boxes, insect hotels [if applicable]
- Tree planting [TARGET]

11. POLLUTION PREVENTION:

- No pollution of air, water, or land
- Spill prevention and response procedures
- Hazardous substance controls (COSHH)
- Noise minimization
- Light pollution reduction
- Proper storage and disposal of chemicals
- Environmental permits/consents obtained as required

12. CLIMATE ADAPTATION:

- Assess climate risks (flooding, extreme weather)
- Business continuity planning for climate events
- Infrastructure resilience (flood defenses, cooling systems)
- Water efficiency (drought resilience)

13. EMPLOYEE ENGAGEMENT:

- Environmental awareness training (induction and annually)
- Green team / environmental champions
- Suggestion scheme for environmental improvements
- Recognition of environmental contributions
- Clear responsibilities (see section 15)

14. MONITORING AND REPORTING:

**KPIs:**
- Carbon emissions (tCO2e) - Scopes 1, 2, 3
- Energy consumption (kWh)
- Water consumption (m³)
- Waste produced (tonnes) and recycling rate (%)
- Business travel (miles/emissions)
- Renewable energy (%)

**Reporting:**
- Monthly KPI tracking
- Annual environmental report [published on website / internal]
- SECR report in Directors' Report (if applicable)
- [ISO 14001 certification / external audit]

**Review:** Annual policy review and environmental management system audit.

15. ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

**Board:** Approve policy, set targets, allocate resources
**Environmental Manager:** [NAME] - Implement policy, monitor performance, reporting
**Facilities Manager:** Energy, waste, water management
**Procurement:** Sustainable sourcing
**Managers:** Ensure team compliance, promote good practices
**All employees:** Follow policy, reduce personal environmental impact, suggest improvements

16. INCIDENTS AND NON-COMPLIANCE:

- Report environmental incidents (spills, breaches) to [ENVIRONMENTAL_MANAGER]
- Investigate root cause
- Take corrective action
- Prevent recurrence
- Report to Environment Agency if required (e.g., pollution incidents)
- Disciplinary action for serious breaches

17. STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT:

- Customers: Communicate environmental initiatives
- Suppliers: Engage on sustainability, require environmental standards
- Community: Consult on local environmental impacts, support local environmental projects
- Regulators: Comply and engage proactively
- Investors: ESG reporting
- Employees: Engage and empower (see section 13)

18. CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT:

- Set environmental objectives and targets (SMART)
- Action plans to achieve targets
- Regular performance review
- Corrective actions for non-conformance
- Lessons learned from incidents
- Adoption of best practices and new technologies
- [ISO 14001 PDCA cycle: Plan-Do-Check-Act]
content.key_legislation_2025:
**SECR (Streamlined Energy and Carbon Reporting):**
Companies with 250+ employees or £36m+ turnover must report annually:
- Energy consumption (UK and offshore)
- Associated greenhouse gas emissions
- Intensity ratio (e.g., emissions per £ revenue)
- Energy efficiency actions

**Environment Act 2021:**
- Biodiversity net gain (10% minimum for development from Nov 2023 for TCPA, Jan 2024 for NSIP)
- Environmental targets (air quality, water, biodiversity, waste)
- Simpler Recycling (consistency in recycling collections from 2025)
- Extended Producer Responsibility (packaging from 2025)
- Deposit Return Scheme (drinks containers, dates TBC)

**Climate Change Act 2008 (as amended):**
- Net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050 (legally binding UK target)
